body:
If you use ShardingSphere as a database, there are lots of dimension need to be consider, for example: stability, latency, TPS of TPCC etc. You may try to test them if you are interested.
But I still have to say, ShardingSphere is different with database, it is database plus. There are lots of features in ShardingSphere, for example: PostgreSQL supported, encryption, etc...
It's interesting to see your design from the configuration, but due to limited information, I can't give a valuable comment, as long as it can satisfy your business, it's good!
@asp1111 Can you provide your sharding configuration and exception info?
@asp1111 What is the exception message? Also, what should I do to reproduce this problem.

> > 
> 
> i want to know how solve this problem

Warm up your service, but don't use multi thread.

> Please fix the CI

@terrymanu  Fixed, please review again, thanks!

@sandynz 
Ok, after the release of 5.1.0, we adjusted all input params to be optional.

### here is exception message
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13173179/150731377-6f1b9626-4f3d-42d1-b388-1ed149acf198.png)
### reproduce this problem
set up two database , create user table  
```sql
    CREATE TABLE `aiot_t_user` (
      `id` int NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT COMMENT 'ID',
      `tenantId` char(7) CHARACTER SET utf8mb4 COLLATE utf8mb4_0900_ai_ci NOT NULL ,
      `departmentId` bigint DEFAULT NULL ,
      `name` varchar(255) CHARACTER SET utf8mb4 COLLATE utf8mb4_0900_ai_ci DEFAULT NULL ,
      `createTime` datetime(6) NOT NULL DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP(6) ,
      PRIMARY KEY (`id`) USING BTREE,
    ) ENGINE=InnoDB AUTO_INCREMENT=399 DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8mb4 COLLATE=utf8mb4_0900_ai_ci;
```

customize  shardingAlggorithm and run sql

```sql
    SELECT
	    id,
	    ROW_NUMBER() OVER ( PARTITION BY departmentId ORDER BY createTime DESC ) 
    FROM
	    aiot_t_user 
    WHERE
	    tenantId = "1004200"
```

i edit it : )

@Ahoo-Wang this issue has been completed, and I have passed the `InstanceContext` to `CosIdKeyGenerateAlgorithm`, you can refactor this algorithm now,  and look forward to using it in the next version.
I will split this issue into more tasks in the next version, I just close it now.

@marker-wu The schema has been split into multiple nodes by table in the upcoming 5.1.0 version, you can try again with master branch now.
Look forward to your next feedback.

OK, thanks for your patience answer. Like many people, I am confused about the problem: how to solve automatic scaling elegantly and simply? I think since many other shard-nothing databases are auto-scaling, how can shardingsphere be done automatically? or must manually exec?
